messages.content: Who is Matti Nykänen?

Matti Nykänen is a Finnish former ski jumper, who was the first person to win three Olympic gold medals in the individual large hill competition. He also won two gold medals and one silver medal in the World Ski Championships.
Who is Juha Mieto?
Juha Mieto is a Finnish former speed skater, who was a four-time Olympic gold medalist. He also won fifteen world championship medals, including seven gold medals.
Why is there are president in Finland?

Finland is a republic with a president who is elected for a fixed six-year term. The powers and responsibilities of the president include approving and appointing the Prime Minister, to whom the president delegates the daily running of the government, and appointing the other ministers.
Does the Pope lead Sweden?

Sweden is a constitutional monarchy with a monarch as the head of state. The monarch’s duties are mostly ceremonial and the actual position is largely symbolic. The monarch’s powers and responsibilities include appointing the prime minister, the cabinet, and the Supreme Court. The monarch is also the commander-in-chief of the armed forces. The monarch does not have the right to veto laws, dissolve the Riksdag, or refuse to sign a bill into law.

The monarch does not have the right to veto laws, dissolve the Riksdag, or refuse to sign a bill into law. There is no Pope of Sweden.

Who is Margot Wallström?

Margot Wallström is a Swedish politician and a former minister of foreign affairs. She was elected as a member of the Swedish Parliament in 1982, and served as the minister of foreign affairs from 2014 until 2019. She became the first woman to hold this position.
